pulls.title: Carlos initial thorough editorial review
pulls.author: cpignata
pulls.body: This PR includes an initial, comprehensive editorial pass across the entire document 📝. It further proposes a way of aligning authorship and editorship with the pre-existing sustainability architecture draft (_Architectural Considerations for Environmental Sustainability_) as an initial step toward merging both effort-sets; this is achieved by adding one editor from each of both documents (i.e., from the existing and from the unpublished), chronologically ordered. This in turn surfaces a bug within the author metadata variables, with a fix adding a role of editor (and removing the (air quotes) 'family name' of "Ed." :writing_hand:. Lastly, it incorporates acknowledgments for all contributors to the existing draft since November 2023. Oh, and adds Mac's .DS_Store to the .gitignore list :smile:

comments.author: jariarkko
comments.body: Also, from some reason GitHub says I don't have permission to push to the main branch. Odd, I thought this is a PR for the my repo, does it refer to your repo (where this is coming from)? I will proceed by implementing these changes separately.

comments.author: cpignata
comments.body:
OK. I had not seen Suresh' actual edits, but my bad if I missed that.
Yes, this is a PR to your repo coming from a clone in my repo. Should be able to push, can you please try again?

comments.author: jariarkko
comments.body: I have separately implemented the suggestions from this PR, as it was impossible to do it directly. Some edits were already done by others, a few were not taken into account. The representation of the author list is still to be determined, we want to acknowledge everyone's contribution, but it may be too early to decide the role of different parties.

comments.author: cpignata
comments.body:
Thanks for implementing separately.
Looks like you missed updating my email address (which is now incorrect, but I'd prefer to use a different email address for this anyway)
We can discuss the editorship order, I shared the logic why I think a chronological order is more sensible (after being editing a sustainbility-architectures document for ~ 1.5 years...

reviews.author: jariarkko
reviews.body: The editorial changes look good, thank you. The editorship situation we will need to discuss, but I will do that separately. For instance, both me and Suresh have to make major edits today, and have a grasp of where the document is at, what parts are not ready and will need to be cut from the -00. So as an example it is inappropriate to remove Suresh's editor designation.

pulls.title: Update draft-various-eimpact-arch-considerations.md
pulls.author: cpignata
pulls.body:
High-level proposal on resiliency and reliability. While at it, fix my email address.
Please note that this proposal is one of minimal changes in this document. That is achieved by specifying which Sections from draft-pignataro-enviro-sustainability-architecture can to be ported (i.e., copy/paste) to the relevant sections of this document, but did not move all the text.
This allows for an easier evaluation of merge changes.

pulls.title: Adding in focus on advice to protocol designers and pointers to drafts for general principles
pulls.author: sureshkrishnan

comments.author: cpignata
comments.body: @sureshkrishnan looks like this change is premature at best without a discussion of positioning of each doc (the 1.5-year-old eimpact edited and this new one)...

comments.author: sureshkrishnan
comments.body: @cpignata , this is certainly something we can discuss moving forward. We spent quite a bit of time discussing the scope in the initial DT meetings and this was the scope that people wanted for this document.

comments.author: cpignata
comments.body:
@sureshkrishnan -- two comments:
1. The main issue is that your text is scoping and chartering **other** drafts... 
> _while other documents such as {{I-D.cparsk-eimpact-sustainability-considerations}} and
{{I-D.pignataro-enviro-sustainability-architecture}} go into more details on the general principles involved_
2. Re- the scoping of this specific draft in your text, is that a consensus call as Chair/Leader of the IAB Program? Not sure how it works in a DT in a program, and I get confused...

comments.author: sureshkrishnan
comments.body: Good point on 1. Carlos. The intent of the text was to point to other relevant sources and not to scope/charter them, but I will remove the text you quoted as it might be taken that way.

comments.author: sureshkrishnan
comments.body:
Regarding 2. this is an individual document and there is no program consensus call at all. In fact as stated in https://www.iab.org/programs/technical-programs/

_**IAB programs cannot publish RFCs. Programs provide input to the IAB discussions on a topic, and the IAB may choose to publish an RFC that takes that input into account, but an IAB program cannot directly publish, or propose to publish, an RFC.**_

comments.author: cpignata
sureshkrishnan
comments.body:
> @sureshkrishnan --
> 
> 1. It's not that _"might be taken that way"_. It's what it objectively says...

Huh?? It was simply a statement of fact. I removed the text because you had read it that way, and I took your interpretation at face value when I said "it might be taken that way". 

> 2. What am I missing? "draft-_**eimpact**_-arch-considerations". Making along as we go!...

Unclear what you mean my "Making along as we go"? The draft is called draft-various-eimpact based on Jari's proposal.

pulls.title: creation of Power Backup Operations section
pulls.author: emile22

comments.author: jariarkko
comments.body:
Suresh: this is related to GREEN power status etc. topics

Marisol: there are some people pushing for power on/off aspects in GREEN WG, but the discussion is still open.

Emile: to make it more precise, this is only about one use case that has not been discussed so much now: when there is a power shortage. I see it as different from the GREEN WG discussion which was mostly about control of power. 

Jari: Agree

Emile: this could be one subclass of scaling. I want to make the fact that we are on battery power and when the battery ends explicit.

Alex: I think it is a question if this a sustainability or power constraint issue, and super important, but is this part of our scope?

Suresh: agree with Alex

Jan: this is a bigger topic than a side comment in our document.

Jari: maybe an item in our "future work" section

Suresh: if we think of this as part of scaling, then we could keep this topic.

AP: Jari to make a proposal

reviews.author: jariarkko
reviews.body: I don't disagree with anything said here, good stuff. However, we are quite thin on actual architectural impacts that would influence protocol design. Can we come up with some?

pulls.title: Ac draft various eimpact arch considerations
pulls.author: alexclemm

comments.author: jariarkko
comments.body:
Discussion on call:

- Alex presented the edits
- Jari: Top part of PR is fine. AP Alex to provide a new version with just these.
- Alex - Jan - Jari - Suresh: discussion about the three subsections. AP: Jan to make a proposal on more sustainability-focused and compact
- Transport modifications: to be discussed under Jari's PR, based but further modified from Alex's proposal. AP: All to review.

reviews.author: jariarkko
reviews.body:
Thank you! Extensive work.

Many things in this PR.

Adding new references: Great, thanks!

General updates on intro & measurement section: Great, thanks!

One exception is that the changes include removing a mention of the GREEN WG. Perhaps we should keep that still explicitly.

The questions on whether some subsections in measurement should be kept:
- agree on "design with users"
- but I'd suggest the two pipeline subsections could be merged under one that simply says:
  "Measurements typically pass through a pipeline from collection to processing (aggregation, unit conversions, etc.) and decisions. Such pipelines should be configurable and modular, as the needs for different type of combining or processing information evolve."

The edits regarding the addition of recommendations from draft-pignataro require more work, could they be separated from this PR? Specifically, I'm working on that, but I think (1) the encoding/decoding aspects belong to a different section that we already have, compact encoding. That section should address both the compactness of the encoding and the effort required to do it.

Secondly, the part about rapid discovery and convergence seems close to what we already have in the dynamic scaling section. A review of what needs to change is needed.

Third, chattiness probably belongs to the transport topic.

Fourth, the exploiting burstiness text piece probably points to a need to generalize the current text in the transport section. But I don't think we should add this text as such. It makes a recommendation for smooth traffic without really exploring the different tradeoffs at all. Not saying the current text in the transport section is perfect in this sense either, in particular it should probably be more open ended what the right behavior is. But there's very much a need talk about the detailed tradeoffs, such as impact on sleep vs. avoiding peak capacity, avoiding disturbance to others vs. taking longer to be awake, micro sleep vs. long sleep periods, etc.

Finally, the I-D.irtf-nmrg-green-ps reference in the recommendations for further work. We definitely should reference it. Could we pick up the more architecture oriented conclusions from it?

pulls.title: Update transport section with additional considerations
pulls.author: jariarkko

comments.author: jariarkko
comments.body:
Alex: note that you have a recommendation that's more for researchers than protocol designers. Be clear about the distinction. Concerned that the document should have an impact on the protocol designers. If we are too broad and general that's not great. But if we keep the general and protocol-designer advice clearly separated then we can perhaps avoid problems.

Suresh: goes in right direction, the question is how actionable result we get. Consider putting text somewhere even if it just about future work needed.

Jari: I like the future work category of "advice". Or the separation of protocol designer advice and further work needed.

```suggestion
for some time, etc.
```

removing a trailing whitespace :-)

```suggestion
for some time, etc.
```

removing a trailing whitespace :-)
